responses.content:

The second statement 'Either the flugel is blimmed or it is zargled' means that the flugel has one of two properties: either it is blimmed or it is zargled.
Since we know that the flugel is not zargled, it must be the case that the flugel is blimmed, because the only other option (zargled) has been ruled out.
